Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on his friendship with a thief called Musashi, the film takes place at the beginning of the Showa period when Japan was undergoing rapid change from Meiji era isolationism to globalised modernity. As such there are juxtapositions between youth culture and business life that abound with numerous shopkeepers producing comedy relief

Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming. Okay let's break it down. Let's start with the acting performances? I really like the voices provided by Colin Farrell (Session9) and Kelly MacDonald (Two family house). Their characterizations were very well defined and both have great comedic talents which brought to life some immensely hilarious scenes from start until the end of

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.
Takes what it needs from earlier pics and stretches the imagination to do something considered in my opinion financially safe yet undeniably --and sometimes unavoidably-- disturbing.
Hmmm I prefer Mean Streets, now don't go for the neckties again!! :P

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue.
